SEARCH
Package org.lujza.quiz.model

Class Question

java.lang.Object
org.lujza.quiz.model.Question
public class Question extends Object
The Question class represents a single question in the quiz, including its text, type (text input, single choice, or multiple choice), and a list of correct and wrong answers. It provides functionality to access question details and to format answers for display.

  • Field Details

    • theme

      private transient Theme theme
      The theme associated with this question, indicating the category or topic to which the question belongs. This field is marked as transient to be ignored by Gson during serialization and deserialization processes.

    • answered

      private transient boolean answered
      A flag indicating whether this question has been answered by the user. It helps in determining how many questions has the user answered at the end of a test.

    • text

      private String text
      The text of the question, presented to the user. It includes the actual question content that the user needs to answer.

    • type

      private String type
      The type of the question, which determines how it should be presented and answered. Common types include "text" for text input, "single" for single-choice, and "multi" for multiple-choice questions.

    • wrongAnswers

      private List<String> wrongAnswers
      A list of incorrect answers for the question. In the case of questions with options, this list provides the wrong options presented alongside the correct ones.

    • correctAnswers

      private List<String> correctAnswers
      A list of the correct answers for the question. Depending on the question type, this might contain one or more correct answers.

    • allAnswers

      private List<String> allAnswers
      A combined list of all answers (both correct and wrong) for this question. This list is typically used for displaying answer options to the user in a randomized order.

  • Constructor Details

    • Question

      public Question()

  • Method Details

    • getTheme

      public Theme getTheme()
      Gets the theme associated with this question.
      Returns:
      The Theme to which this question belongs.

    • setTheme

      public void setTheme(Theme theme)
      Sets the theme associated with this question.
      Parameters:
      theme - The Theme to which this question will be associated.

    • isAnswered

      public boolean isAnswered()
      Checks if the question has already been answered by the user.
      Returns:
      true if the question has been answered; false otherwise.

    • setAnswered

      public void setAnswered(boolean answered)
      Sets the answered state of the question. This method is used to mark a question as answered or unanswered, typically after the user has attempted to answer it. Updating the answered state helps in tracking the user's progress.
      Parameters:
      answered - the new answered state of the question; true if the question has been answered, otherwise false.

    • getText

      public String getText()
      Gets the text of this question.
      Returns:
      The question text as a String.

    • getCorrectAnswers

      public List<String> getCorrectAnswers()
      Gets the list of correct answers for this question.
      Returns:
      A List of String objects representing the correct answers.

    • answersToMap

      private Map<String,String> answersToMap()
      Converts the list of all answers (correct and wrong) to a map for easier access. This internal method is used to format answers when presenting them to the user.
      Returns:
      A Map with answer options as keys and answer texts as values.

    • getAllAnswersMap

      public Map<String,String> getAllAnswersMap()
      Provides a map of all answer options (correct and wrong) mixed together and shuffled. This method is used to display answer options to the user in a randomized order.
      Returns:
      A Map with letters as keys (e.g., 'a', 'b', 'c',...) and the shuffled answer texts as values.

    • isTextInput

      public boolean isTextInput()
      Checks if the question type requires a text input answer.
      Returns:
      true if the question type is "text"; false otherwise.

    • isSingleAnswer

      public boolean isSingleAnswer()
      Checks if the question is of single answer type.
      Returns:
      true if the question type is "single"; false otherwise.

    • isMultipleAnswer

      public boolean isMultipleAnswer()
      Checks if the question allows for multiple answers to be selected.
      Returns:
      true if the question type is "multi"; false otherwise.
